noun.description: An opaque or semitransparent glassy substance applied to metallic or other hard surfaces for ornament or as a protective coating.

verb.description: Coat or decorate (a metallic or hard object) with enamel.

origin: Late Middle English (originally as a verb; formerly also as inamel): from Anglo-Norman French enamailler, from en- in, on + amail enamel, ultimately of Germanic origin.
